moves.1. e4 c5 2. Nc3:
closed sicilian, very popular these days. don't know why...
in my opinion it's a bit passive for white.
moves.2... Nc6 3. Nf3 Nf6 4. d3:
why not d4?
it seems white is afraid from the main lines here.
moves.5. Be2: it is beeter to take the pawn. where would the Knight go after d4?
moves.5... d4 6. Nb1 e5: black gained lots of space in an opening he should fight for this space.
moves.7. Na3: the Knight plays for the third time now... what with the other pieces?
moves.7... Be7 8. Nc4 Qc7 9. O-O b5: in the next move the white will play his 5th move with the Knight. just half of the moves he made. a terrible waist of time.
moves.10. Ncd2 O-O 11. b3: now c3 is a great hole.
moves.11... a6 12. c4:
??
white forgot abot d:c3 e.p.
now black is 1 pawn up and a great position.
moves.12... dxc3 e.p. 13. Nb1: its the third time the Knight stands on b1.
moves.13... b4 14. a3 Be6: keeping the pressure on white. b3, a3 and d3 are very weak.
moves.15. Bg5 Na5 16. axb4 cxb4 17. d4 Nxb3: two great passing pawns. these are unstopable!
moves.21. Rc1 e4: black reviles his other attack - the King side!
moves.22. Qd4 exf3:
and now h2 is very weak.
it is just a matter of time.
